thread.title: Fast start propels Forks past Newark Valley in Class C showdown
thread.title_full: Fast start propels Forks past Newark Valley in Class C showdown

title: Fast start propels Forks past Newark Valley in Class C showdown
text:
Fast start propels Forks past Newark Valley in Class C showdown 
By wbng sports October 11, 2015 Updated Oct 11, 2015 at 12:11 AM EDT 
Newark Valley, NY (WBNG Binghamton) Chenango Forks used a couple of sustained drives and a couple of big plays to jump out to a 27-0 halftime lead over Newark Valley. The Blue Devils then held on to win 34-21 and clinch their fourth straight divisional title. 
"It means a lot because obviously," said senior Tony Silvanic. "They're such a good team and we knew it was going to be a tough game, so it means a lot being senior season and a tough team like that, so it's a really nice feeling to win that one." 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
The game was similar to the start of last year's Section IV Class C title game between the two. Just like on Saturday, the Blue Devils rushed out to an early lead on their way to a win. 
"You know our kids were certainly ready, excited and we talked about how important it is to have a good start and we certainly had a great start," said coach Dave Hogan. "The first half couldn't have been better." 
It's the Cardinals first loss of the season, while Forks moves to 5-1 on the year. 
Walton 42 - Unadilla Valley 32: Unadilla Valley stormed out to a 12-0 lead on the road, but Walton responded with a big second half. The Warriors improved to 5-1 with the 10-point win at home. 
Susquehanna Valley 27 - Lansing 6: Susquehanna Valley scored the first 27 points of the game on its way to a 27-6 victory on Homecoming over Lansing. 
Unatego/Franklin 34 - Delhi 13: Unatego/Franklin pulled away from Delhi for a 34-14 win on the road. It was the Spartans second win of the year. 
Oxford 42 - Seton 0: Oxford rolled past Seton, 42-0, for a win in Binghamton on Saturday night. To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
